subject: Communication
title: Scarcity: The Fear of Missing Out
description: A quick win: understand Scarcity: The Fear of Missing Out.

hook.text: 'Only 2 left in stock!' Your heart rate spikes. You buy it immediately. You didn't even need it.

buildup.text: Scarcity makes things feel more valuable. Limited time offers, exclusive access, and waitlists all exploit this.

discovery.text: In a famous study, cookies from a near-empty jar were rated tastier than identical cookies from a full jar.

twist.text: Scarcity triggers loss aversion â€” we fear losing an opportunity more than we value gaining an equal one.

climax.text: Airlines, ticket sellers, and online retailers weaponize scarcity counters to create artificial urgency.

punchline.text: Scarcity doesn't change value. It changes perception.

quiz.question: What cognitive bias does scarcity primarily exploit?
